ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.2_0: At that time a government official who was Venerable Channa’s supporter was making him a dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.3_0: When the dwelling was finished, Channa had it roofed and plastered again and again.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.5_0: Then, while collecting grass and sticks, Channa spoiled the barley field belonging to a certain brahmin.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.6_0: The brahmin then complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.7_0: “How can the venerables see our barber?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.8_0: The monks heard the complaints of that brahmin,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.9_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.10_0: “How can Venerable Channa have a finished dwelling roofed and plastered again and again, so that it collapsed from overloading?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.11_0: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.12_0: “Is it true, Channa, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.15_0: “... Foolish man, how can you have a finished dwelling roofed and plastered again and again, so that it collapses from overloading?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.16_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.17_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.18.1_0: ‘When a monk builds a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and transferred to it, then they should apply themselves to the end.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.18.1_1: If he applies more than that, even if he stands where there are no cultivated plants, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.2_0: one with an owner is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.4_0: A plastered inside or out, a plastered inside or outside,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.6_0: is making or is having made.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.8_0: the Fortunate One’s Community of Nunnels around the back,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.10_0: for the fixing of the door.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.12_0: for treating the window openings there is white color, black color, and treating with red ocher; making a garland pattern, a creeper pattern, a shark-teeth pattern, and the fivefold pattern.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.13_0: Standing where there are no cultivated plants, he may apply two or three courses of roofing material:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.15_0: if he applies it while standing where there are cultivated plants, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.16_0: For someone covering in lines, after covering with two layers, he may ask for a third layer, and he should then depart.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.17_0: For someone covering in circles, after covering with two layers, he may ask for a third layer, and he should then depart.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.18_0: If he applies more than that, even if he stands where there are no cultivated plants:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.19_0: if he is covering with bricks, then for every brick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.20_0: If he is covering with slate, then for every piece of slate, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.21_0: If he is covering with plaster, then for every lump, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.22_0: If he is covering with grass, then for every handful, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.23_0: If he is covering with leaves, then for every leaf, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.1_0: If it is more than two or three courses, and he perceives it as more, and he applies it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.2_0: If it is more than two or three courses, but he is unsure of it, and he applies it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.3_0: If it is more than two or three courses, but he perceives it as less, and he applies it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.4_0: If it is less than two or three courses, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.5_0: If it is less than two or three courses, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.6_0: If it is less than two or three courses, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.2_0: if he applies two or three courses;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.3_0: if he applies less than two or three courses;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.6_0: if it is a grass hut;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.7_0: if it is built for someone else;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.8_0: if it is by means of her own property;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.9_0: if anywhere apart from the fire hut, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.11_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.12_0: The ninth rule, the training rule on large dwellings, is finished.
